message_1: In a Caesar cipher, the letter "A" is encrypted as "D", "B" as "E", and so on. If a message in Caesar cipher reads "Lw fdqw Zduudub", what is the original message?
message_2:
To decrypt a Caesar cipher, we need to shift the letters back by the same number of positions used for encryption. In this case, the shift is 3 positions back.

L -> I
w -> t
(space)
f -> c
d -> a
q -> n
w -> t
(space)
Z -> W
d -> a
r -> o
r -> o
n -> k
a -> x
b -> y

So, the original message is "It cant Wookxy". However, it seems there might be a mistake in the encrypted message, as "Wookxy" doesn't form a coherent word. If the encrypted message was "Lw fdqw Zrunqlq", the decrypted message would be "It cant Working", which makes more sense.
